info.title: DataLakeAnalyticsJobManagementClient
info.description: Creates an Azure Data Lake Analytics job client.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The Azure Data Lake Analytics account to execute job operations on.

post.description: Gets statistics of the specified job.
Gets the U-SQL job debug data information specified by the job ID.
Builds (compiles) the specified job in the specified Data Lake Analytics account for job correctness and validation.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to build a job.

post.description: Cancels the running job specified by the job ID.

get.description: Gets the job information for the specified job ID.

put.description: Submits a job to the specified Data Lake Analytics account.

parameters.name: jobIdentity
parameters.description: The job ID (a GUID) for the job being submitted.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to submit a job.

get.description: Lists the jobs, if any, associated with the specified Data Lake Analytics account. The response includes a link to the next page of results, if any.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: OData expansion. Expand related resources in line with the retrieved resources, e.g. Categories/$expand=Products would expand Product data in line with each Category entry. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description: A free form search. A free-text search expression to match for whether a particular entry should be included in the feed, e.g. Categories?$search=blue OR green. Optional.

parameters.name: $format
parameters.description: The return format. Return the response in particular format without access to request headers for standard content-type negotiation (e.g Orders?$format=json). Optional.

dataRead.description: Gets the amount of data read, in bytes.

dataReadCrossPod.description: Gets the amount of data read across multiple pods, in bytes.

dataReadIntraPod.description: Gets the amount of data read in one pod, in bytes.

dataToRead.description: Gets the amount of data remaining to be read, in bytes.

dataWritten.description: Gets the amount of data written, in bytes.

duplicateDiscardCount.description: Gets the number of duplicates that were discarded.

failedCount.description: Gets the number of failures that occurred in this stage.

maxVertexDataRead.description: Gets the maximum amount of data read in a single vertex, in bytes.

minVertexDataRead.description: Gets the minimum amount of data read in a single vertex, in bytes.

readFailureCount.description: Gets the number of read failures in this stage.

revocationCount.description: Gets the number of vertices that were revoked during this stage.

runningCount.description: Gets the number of currently running vertices in this stage.

scheduledCount.description: Gets the number of currently scheduled vertices in this stage

stageName.description: Gets the name of this stage in job execution.

succeededCount.description: Gets the number of vertices that succeeded in this stage.

tempDataWritten.description: Gets the amount of temporary data written, in bytes.

totalCount.description: Gets the total vertex count for this stage.

totalFailedTime.description: Gets the amount of time that failed vertices took up in this stage.

totalProgress.description: Gets the current progress of this stage, as a percentage.

totalSucceededTime.description: Gets the amount of time all successful vertices took in this stage.

JobStatisticsVertexStage.description: The Data Lake Analytics U-SQL job statistics vertex stage information.

lastUpdateTimeUtc.description: Gets the last update time for the statistics.

stages.description: Gets the list of stages for the job.

JobStatistics.description: The Data Lake Analytics U-SQL job execution statistics.

jobId.description: Gets the id of the job this data is for.

command.description: Gets the command that this job data relates to.

paths.description: Gets the list of paths to all of the job data.

JobDataPath.description: A Data Lake Analytics U-SQL job data path item.

newState.description: Gets the new state the job is in.

timeStamp.description: Gets the time stamp that the state change took place.

requestedByUser.description: Gets the user who requests the change.

details.description: Gets  the details of the audit log.

JobStateAuditRecord.description: The Data Lake Analytics U-SQL job state audit records for tracking the lifecycle of a job.

name.description: Gets or set the name of the resource.

resourcePath.description: Gets or sets the path to the resource.

type.description: Gets or sets the job resource type.

JobResource.description: The Data Lake Analytics U-SQL job resources.

resources.description: Gets or sets the list of resources that are required by the job

statistics.description: Gets or sets the job specific statistics.

debugData.description: Gets or sets the job specific debug data locations.

algebraFilePath.description: Gets the U-SQL algebra file path after the job has completed

totalCompilationTime.description: Gets the total time this job spent compiling. This value should not be set by the user and will be ignored if it is.

totalPauseTime.description: Gets the total time this job spent paused. This value should not be set by the user and will be ignored if it is.

totalQueuedTime.description: Gets the total time this job spent queued. This value should not be set by the user and will be ignored if it is.

totalRunningTime.description: Gets the total time this job spent executing. This value should not be set by the user and will be ignored if it is.

rootProcessNodeId.description: Gets the ID used to identify the job manager coordinating job execution. This value should not be set by the user and will be ignored if it is.

yarnApplicationId.description: Gets the ID used to identify the yarn application executing the job. This value should not be set by the user and will be ignored if it is.

yarnApplicationTimeStamp.description: Gets the timestamp (in ticks) for the yarn application executing the job. This value should not be set by the user and will be ignored if it is.

compileMode.description: Gets or sets the compile mode for the job.

logLocation.description: Gets or sets the log location for this statement.

resultPreviewLocation.description: Gets or sets the result preview location for this statement.

resultLocation.description: Gets or sets the result location for this statement.

errorMessage.description: Gets or sets the error message for this statement.

statementInfo.description: Gets or sets the statement information for each statement in the script

logsLocation.description: Gets or sets the Hive logs location

warehouseLocation.description: Gets or sets the runtime version of the U-SQL engine to use

statementCount.description: Gets or sets the number of statements that will be run based on the script

executedStatementCount.description: Gets or sets the number of statements that have been run based on the script

runtimeVersion.description: Gets or sets the runtime version of the U-SQL engine to use

script.description: Gets or sets the U-SQL script to run

type.description: Gets or sets the job type of the current job (i.e. Hive or U-SQL).

JobProperties.description: The common Data Lake Analytics job properties.

details.description: Gets the details of the error message.

endOffset.description: Gets the end offset in the job where the error was found.

errorId.description: Gets the specific identifier for the type of error encountered in the job.

filePath.description: Gets the path to any supplemental error files, if any.

helpLink.description: Gets the link to MSDN or Azure help for this type of error, if any.

internalDiagnostics.description: Gets the internal diagnostic stack trace if the user requesting the job error details has sufficient permissions it will be retrieved, otherwise it will be empty.

lineNumber.description: Gets the specific line number in the job where the error occurred.

message.description: Gets the user friendly error message for the failure.

resolution.description: Gets the recommended resolution for the failure, if any.

InnerError.description: Gets the inner error of this specific job error message, if any.

severity.description: Gets the severity level of the failure.

source.description: Gets the ultimate source of the failure (usually either SYSTEM or USER).

startOffset.description: Gets the start offset in the job where the error was found

JobErrorDetails.description: The Data Lake Analytics job error details.

severity.description: Gets the severity level of the failure.

details.description: Gets the details of the error message.

errorId.description: Gets the specific identifier for the type of error encountered in the job.

helpLink.description: Gets the link to MSDN or Azure help for this type of error, if any.

internalDiagnostics.description: Gets the internal diagnostic stack trace if the user requesting the job error details has sufficient permissions it will be retrieved, otherwise it will be empty.

message.description: Gets the user friendly error message for the failure.

resolution.description: Gets the recommended resolution for the failure, if any.

source.description: Gets the ultimate source of the failure (usually either SYSTEM or USER).

JobInnerError.description: The Data Lake Analytics job error details.

jobId.description: Gets or sets the job's unique identifier (a GUID).

name.description: Gets or sets the friendly name of the job.

type.description: Gets or sets the job type of the current job (Hive or USql).

submitter.description: Gets or sets the user or account that submitted the job.

errorMessage.description: Gets the error message details for the job, if the job failed.

degreeOfParallelism.description: Gets or sets the degree of parallelism used for this job. This must be greater than 0.

degreeOfParallelismPercent.description: the degree of parallelism in percentage used for this job.

priority.description: Gets or sets the priority value for the current job. Lower numbers have a higher priority. By default, a job has a priority of 1000. This must be greater than 0.

submitTime.description: Gets the time the job was submitted to the service.

startTime.description: Gets the start time of the job.

endTime.description: Gets the completion time of the job.

state.description: Gets the job state. When the job is in the Ended state, refer to Result and ErrorMessage for details.

result.description: Gets the result of job execution or the current result of the running job.

stateAuditRecords.description: Gets the job state audit records, indicating when various operations have been performed on this job.

hierarchyQueueNode.description: the name of hierarchy queue node this job is assigned to, null if job has not been assigned yet or the account doesn't have hierarchy queue.

properties.description: Gets or sets the job specific properties.

JobInformation.description: The common Data Lake Analytics job information properties.

value.description: Gets the list of jobInfo items.

nextLink.description: Gets the link (url) to the next page of results.

count.description: Gets the total count of results that are available, but might not be returned in the current page.

adlaJobDnsSuffixInPath.name: adlaJobDnsSuffix
adlaJobDnsSuffixInPath.description: Gets the DNS suffix used as the base for all Azure Data Lake Analytics Job service requests.
